wikipedia_page.main: George Townshend, 2nd Marquess Townshend, PC, FRS (18 April 1753 – 27 July 1811), known as The Lord Ferrers of Chartley from 1770 to 1784 and as The Earl of Leicester from 1784 to 1807, was a British peer and politician.

response: *George Townshend, 2nd Marquess Townshend, 1st Earl of Leicester (1753–1811)
*George Townshend, 2nd Marquess Townshend, 1st Earl of Leicester (1753–1811)
*25px George Townshend, 2nd Marquess Townshend, 17th Baron Ferrers of Chartley (1755–1811);
*George Townshend, 2nd Marquess Townshend (1753–1811), British peer and politician, his son

Townshend was born on 13 December 1778, the elder son and heir of George Townshend, 2nd Marquess Townshend, 5th Viscount Townshend, 1st Earl of Leicester, 17th Baron Ferrers of Chartley, 8th Baron Compton (1753-1811), by his wife Charlotte Ellerker. Townshend was educated at Eton College and Trinity College, Cambridge.
